column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: South Carolina
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 2. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 3. If you see a cyclist in your lane ahead, you should:
column4: lightly tap the horn to avoid startling the cyclist.
column6: treat the cyclist as any other vehicle.

column2: 4. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column6: If it's been raining several hours.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 5. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column6: to signal all lane changes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 6. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column6: delay near it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 8. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before you enter the crosswalk.
column6: after you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 9. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 10. This sign indicates:
column4: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Warning: drunk drivers.

column2: 11. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Listen to heavy metal music.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 12. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column6: High emphasis warning.

column2: 13. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 14. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Edge line
column6: Diamond

column2: 15. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 16. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
column4: before midnight.
column6: before consuming alcohol.

column2: 17. The road is the most slippery:
column4: after it rains.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 18. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Construction warning.
column6: Stop.

column2: 19. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 20. If a law enforcement officer directs you to go through an intersection with a red traffic light without stopping, you should:
column4: go through the intersection without stopping.
column6: stop until the light turns green.
column8: report the law enforcement officer to the relevant authorities.

column2: 21. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 22. Vehicle drivers should never move into the same lane with a motorcycle side-by-side.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 23. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 24. When you are being passed by another driver, you should:
column4: be on guard so that you may protect yourself from any of his/her potentially unsafe actions.
column6: Maintain speed and position when being passed.

column2: 25. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: causes the front wheels to lock.
column6: keeps the brakes from freezing.
column8: is the best option during winter.

column2: 26. SCDMV must be notified within ___ days of any name or address changes.
27. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
28. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: increase your speed immediately.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 29. The distance your vehicle will travel when you need to come to a stop is not affected by speed.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 30. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
